Meteo#

spy4cast.meteo Module#

class spy4cast.meteo.CrossvalidationOut(zhat: numpy.ndarray, scf: numpy.ndarray, r_z_zhat_t: numpy.ndarray, p_z_zhat_t: numpy.ndarray, r_z_zhat_s: numpy.ndarray, p_z_zhat_s: numpy.ndarray, r_uv: numpy.ndarray, p_uv: numpy.ndarray, us: numpy.ndarray, alpha: float)#
class spy4cast.meteo.MCAOut(RUY: numpy.ndarray, RUY_sig: numpy.ndarray, SUY: numpy.ndarray, SUY_sig: numpy.ndarray, RUZ: numpy.ndarray, RUZ_sig: numpy.ndarray, SUZ: numpy.ndarray, SUZ_sig: numpy.ndarray, Us: numpy.ndarray, Vs: numpy.ndarray, scf: numpy.ndarray)#
class spy4cast.meteo.Meteo#

Class containing functions to carry out on the dataset

classmethod anom(array: xarray.core.dataarray.DataArray, st: bool = False) → xarray.core.dataarray.DataArray#

Function to calculate the anomalies :param array: Array to process the anomalies. Fisrt dimension must be time :param st: bool to indicate whether the method should standarize

static npanom(array: numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.float64]], axis: int = 0, st: bool = False) → numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.float64]]#

Function to calculate the anomalies :param array: Array to process the anomalies. space x time :param st: bool to indicate whether the method should standarize

classmethod mca(z: numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.float64]], y: numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.float64]], nmes: int, nm: int, alpha: float) → spy4cast.meteo.MCAOut#

” Maximum covariance analysis between y (predictor) and Z (predictand)

Parameters

  • z – predictand

  • y – predictor. space x time.

  • nm – number of modes

  • nmes – es datos meses metes al año. Si haces la media estacional es 1, pero si metes enero y feb por separado es 2

  • alpha – significant level

Returns

RUY, RUY_sig, SUY, SUY_sig, RUZ, RUZ_sig, SUZ, SUZ_sig, us, Vs, scf

static index_regression(data: numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.float64]], index: numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.float64]], alpha: float) → Tuple[numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.float64]], numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.float64]], numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.float64]], numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.float64]], numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.float64]]]#

Create correlation (using pearson correlation) and regression :param data: data (space, time) :param index: array of temporal series :param alpha: Significant level :return: Correlation map, map with p values, significative corrrelation map, regression map, significative regression map

Tuple

Tuple type; Tuple[X, Y] is the cross-product type of X and Y.
